result.execSummary:
The defendant Tonya M Karimi was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Dated June 12, 2015 filed by the Defendant requesting the Court modify the judgment of conviction removing the DNA surcharge.

Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel and billing statement, received and filed, by Attorney Sarah Ponath.
from ProHealth Care filed by Defense
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Tonya M Karimi in court with attorney Sarah A Ponath.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 2 dismissed and read-in. 

Court orders the following:
Ct. 1:
-  9 months jail jail straight time STAYED for  1 year Probation
- Court Costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.  Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling or any other approved activity by agent.  No violent contact with Darrell S..   Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided.
 - Defendant to perform 40 hours of community service at a rate of $10.00 per hour to offset the fine and costs w/in one year.
No contact with witnesses listed in the complaint. No contact with Woodman's.

Defendant Tonya M Karimi in court with attorney Sarah A Ponath.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Criminal Complaint addressed.  Reading waived. - NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Defense requests a date for a global resolution. Court sets bail at $750.00 signature bond with conditions.  Hearing scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Dated March 16, 2015 filed by Attorney Ponath requesting that the Contract Appointment on Defendant's case 14CM1449 be extended to case 15CM421.
Request granted Attorney Ponath appointed on both 14CM1449 and 15CM421.
